CommonsFunction: ^"You probably already came through here to get to our room."
^] "Anyway, this is sort of a big hub area."
^"The front desk is nearby, so if you need anything there or are expecting any packages, there's where you go."
^"The Commons is also obviously a big social area."
^Which is why I tend to avoid it...
^The only other person in sight is...

b: ^It doesn't look like Max has found them yet.
^But, I know where they are. should I...

FindersKeepers: ^I sneak away from Timothy for a brief moment to the couch Max had mentioned losing the keys in.
^I fish the keys out of the couch cushion and find the spare copy for my room, and pocket that one. Finders keepers after all.
^I stuff the Keys back where I found them, and then casually walk back to where Timothy is standing.
^Timothy seems to be preoccupied watching Max.

g-0: ^"If I'm having a bad day, I sometimes come here. Social interaction helps with my uh... depression, but it can be kinda stressful."
^"I dunno exactly what your needs are, but the Commons are a good place to go if you want to be around people."
^Timothy has frozen where I had last looked, and is shaking slightly.
^The kid looks like I caught him stealing cookies from a cookie jar, or something.
^"<jitter>I-I'm sorry I insulted Max and mis-gendered th-them!</jitter>"
^"You said you're sorry, and you didn't mean to be disrespectful or anything. It's no harm, no foul dude."
^Honestly, what kind of life did this kid have where he thinks people would get mad over something like that?
^I mean, yeah, some people will get mad if he refused to correct himself, or make a big deal out of it or something.
^And Max is the most chill person I know, and has tolerated much worse crap than that.

b: ^As for me? I'm usually too apathetic to care about slight mishaps like that.
^Again, assuming their not being a jerk about it.
^Man, I am going to have to walk on egg shells around this kid, aren't I?
^Man, if he's having a freak-out over this, it's no wonder he breaks down by the end of the week.

g-0: ^I give Timothy a minute to collect himself before continuing the tour.

Awkward: ^Leaving that awkward conversation behind us, its time to move on!
^I shuffle Timothy off to another part of the building to continue the tour.

c: ^I instinctively correct Timothy on Max's pronouns, out of near habit.
^I however, see Timothy begining to retreat inward at that slight mistep. I quickly add-
^I decide not to correct Timothy, mostly because I don't want to set him off on an anxiety spiral.
^I, however, don't seem to have to say anything, as Timothy freezes up, seemingly realizing the mistake on his own.

g-0: ^"Don't worry, if you make a mistake like that. It's an honest mistake. Max'll understand."
^Timothy looks at me, as if I've read his mind.
^Honestly, I'm pretty sure Max'd be more worried as to why Timothy is having a near breakdown over this mistake than the fact they got misgendered.
^"Timothy, I don't really know what kind of life you've had up til now, but your safe here."
^He asks as if he genuinely hasn't considered that before. @I chuckle again.
^I briefly try to picture max being genuinely angry at someone, and not their usual play-mad. Its about as realistic as an M.C. Esher painting.
^] "People don't get mad at slight slips of the tongue. they get made at being disrespected and invalidated."
^"Words can be used to do that, but its the intent. You, Timothy, are fine."
^I try to word it as confidantly as possible to aswage Timothy's fears. I don't know if I succeeded.
^] "hey, don't worry about it. Your here to heal remember? You've got nothing to apologize for."

Calming: ^Leaving that awkward conversation behind us, its time to move on!
^I shuffle Timothy off to another part of the building to continue the tour.

NonBinaryBonus: ^Timothy starts shaking, looking away from me in embarrassment, before giving me a wobbly thumbs up.
^"<jitter>A-and I-I-I'm s-sorry if I-I sc-screw up, an-and pl-please correct m-me if I do.</jitter>"
^It's reaching peak awkwardness now, but it's kinda sweet and I appreciate the gesture, as unnecessary as it is.
^It does relax me a little, so thats nice. @Stress decreased slightly!
